snippet: As E.V.’s become more common, there is continued debate over setting standards for the vehicles. One of the issues, yet to be resolved, is the look of road signs that tell drivers where they can recharge.
abstract: Debate continues over setting standards for electric vehicles, as they become more common; one issue yet to be resolved is the look of road signs that tell drivers where they can charge their vehicles. (M)
lead_paragraph: IN the effort to establish standards that will encourage the acceptance of electric vehicles, there has been much wrangling over the development of a universal design for the plugs that connect battery chargers to cars. That is not the only E.V. debate under way, however. A less contentious, but still important, issue -- the look of the road signs that tell drivers where they can top off a waning battery -- has yet to be resolved.

headline.main: Pointing the Way to Where E.V. Drivers Can Plug In
